markdown: A lovely compliment to any meat dish and always a summer favorite.

ingredients.name: thick cut bacon slices cut to 1/3 inch pieces

markdown: 1. Peel the potatoes and boil in a large covered pot of salted water until tender.
2. Drain and set aside to cool. When cool, slice thinly into a serving bowl. Set aside.
3. Brown the bacon in a large skillet until crisped. Remove the crisped bacon and drain on paper towels and then add to the potatoes.
4. Add the onion to the pan drippings and saut√© until golden brown.
5. Stir in the flour, sugar, salt, celery seed, and pepper. Cook on low heat until bubbly.
6. Stir in the water and the vinegar and heat until boiling, continue to stir and cook for one minute until slightly thickened.
7. Pour the hot dressing over the potatoes and bacon, mix together carefully and serve hot.
